Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a cheap rate !”
Reviews.Author: Stefan M
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from germany by a LIDL offer (Supermarket chain in germany). The hotel is located in a safe and clean area and it is only a few minuted from the Dubai Metro station. This makes it really easy to reach most of the important places in Dubai by the Metro by a daily ticket. The hotel itself is clean and the personal is very kind and helpful. If you book a standard room you may have no "really" view out of the window as the rooms are located to the patio of the hotel. But this was no problem from our point of view as we spent only the nights inside the hotel. The breakfast is continental and it changes every day in the selections. Trips and tours can be booked in the hotel or by the travel agancy. There is also a small shop in the hotel which offers some souveniers and postcards if needet, for an accepable price. We would travel again to Dubai and choose this hotel as it has a good Price performance ratio.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeordieCouple2829
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard double room for 4 nights in February. The staff were very friendly and we were lucky to get our room key before the specified check in time. The room itself was large and clean. You had a kitchen area and living room as you go into the room and then a separate bedroom and bathroom with a bath and a separate shower. For our taste the mattress was a little hard but that is only personal preference and doesn’t reflect badly on the hotel. We found the breakfast to be just average but it was free with the room and gave you a good start to the day. The hotel is in a brilliant location for getting around Dubai itself – there is a metro station Sharaf DG just across the road from the hotel which is a fantastic way to get around Dubai. There were also taxis around the front entrance of the hotel at most times. The Mall of the Emirates was only 5-10 minute walk away from the hotel or one stop on the metro. The pool and Jacuzzi on the roof are lovely and the water was heated which is a bonus in February. The hotel also offers Wi-Fi for 15 AED per 24 hours which we thought was a decent price and the internet was reliable and fast enough for browsing etc. All in all we would definitely return to Dubai and would stay in this hotel again. The only negative was it not overlooking the beach etc but we knew that before we travelled and it was easy enough to get to by taxi and for the price you pay I personally prefer this.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Corina937
Reviews.Content: Very good location (in front of metro station and 10 min. walk to the Mall of Emirates), large rooms, clean, staff very helpfull, good and various breakfast. Recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the price”
Reviews.Author: novisfamily
Reviews.Content: We were a little dubious as we got a good price, but the rooms were very good and the breakfast was also very good. The metro station is dirctley opposite and getting a 10 journey type is worth while. Short walk to the Mall of the Emirates. we will definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: AlexandraMT
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, very clean rooms, comfortable, excelent location!

Reviews.Title: “Recomended”
Reviews.Author: desertrose53
Reviews.Content: We were quite pleased with the Cassells al Barsha hotel. Location is in some way prime, being in front of a Metro station and a five or six minute walk to the Mall of the Emirates. A few minutes by taxi to Jumeirah beach. Taxis are available out front and CHEAP, we used them often. There is a great market in front that can take care of any need and a few restaurants as well. The room was big, clean and quiet. I was surprised to find FULL amenites in the bath. A flat screen television with ample English stations and news and a room safe and refrigerator rounded everything off nicely. The roof pool area was amazing, LARGE with a jaccuzi as well. We only used the restaurant for breakfast and found no problem at all. American and European buffet with local items as well. We would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “yeah”
Reviews.Author: 619dishyd
Reviews.Content: hotel was very nice and comfortable, rooms were clean and big hotel in a good area in front of metro station which is good for getting around. pool area was amazing but need more sun beds as it is on the rooftop good place for tanning.staff were very helpful and proffessional, only bad thing was that breakfast was cold everyday for the 5 days we stayed there as only one feul burner under chaving dish. overall it was great

Reviews.Title: “Good choice.”
Reviews.Author: almuhalhal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable and nice. Suite was good sized and clean.

Reviews.Title: “A more than decent business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Springweed
Reviews.Content: Upon landing in Dubai and having gotten done with immigration (which took much longer than expected maybe cos it was immediately after Ramzan), I got into a taxi and went straight to the hotel. The check-in process was easy and fast. The room I was shown into was clean, nice smelling and had a more than decent loo. The TV provided in the room had the option of plugging in my laptop through HDMI. Since it was late (past 11pm), I ordered a salad and some basic quick eats. The food was good and was presented well. Breakfast spread was adequate with the essentials in place. I actually enjoyed my breakfast for all the 3 days I was there. I can't say the same about most of the hotels I have stayed at. The internet connectivity was good. People told me that other hotels provide free internet. But I wouldn't really complain about paying 15 AED for 24 hours of unlimited 1 mbps connectivity which actually delivered the speed it promised. The area around had multiple supermarkets and restaurants, which I also sampled. The best part of the hotel is its proximity to the 'Mall of the Emirates', a few minutes walk from the hotel. Spent time at the mall every evening. Window-shopped mostly and bought some stuff. The mall has a Carrefour for people who want to do some extensive value-shopping at Dubai. Taxis are readily available just outside the hotel to go anywhere. The staff were helpful and unobtrusive. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: alyeldomery
Reviews.Content: room was very clean, very quiet, good area, paid parking available, very cheap for what you get, actually the TV was out I called them they came in less then 10 min. good breakfast, no one was there to help me with my bags, but still i felt good in the place

Reviews.Title: “A very good budget family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mido2003
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4.we stayed from the 5 th till the 12 th of September.2011.cassels is a very good hotel for family.good location Near metro station which is one stop from Dubai mall.very quite.nice Pool on the top with jaccuzi.also there is a laundry .car rental a step away.I really liked this hotel and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it”
Reviews.Author: Indianspirit
Reviews.Content: Trip started on bad note. The safe deposit box in the room was not working (that can happen in any hotel). After calling the reception twice, the maintenance guy came in after 30 minutes (this does not happen in any good hotel) and its batteries replaced in another 30 minutes. The bathroom slab had lot of dust on it. Apparently, some drilling was done, but no one cared to clean it again. Breakfast was average. The room has a piece of paper proudly announcing water, tea coffee sugar sachet etc. is complimentry, but thats not the case. We asked for another bottle of water. Room service came with water and a bill (the price was steep for a hotel of this standard). When we said since you did not inform us about the cost, take it back. This fellow says its been entered in the system and nothing can be done now. Next day, wanted to raise the issue with the manager, he was arrogant. My complaints: 1.maintenance not prompt, 2. at least the customer should be told what he will charged for a service that another piece in the room claims complimentry. 3. The manager probably come from an army background and not hospitality background.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the hotel very much and would like to stay again”
Reviews.Author: amitjainguwahati
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good.The hotel is nice and clean and the rooms are vry big.The staffs are very helpful.The food quality is very good.The hotel is in quite location and is very good for those people who likes to stay free from noise.The hotel is located ner to mall of emirates.We will like to stay there again.The hotel is full value for the money spend.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: desertdiablo
Reviews.Content: After staying at Ibis Al Barsha, this place is luxury. Large rooms. Comfortable beds. A mini fridge. A hot water kettle. A nice gym. A pleasant rooftop pool and jaccuzi. Wet and dry saunas. Real bathtubs (but the design is strange as others note, so be very careful). The restaurant is adequate. Some hot foods savory and tasty, other things greasy. This is a dry hotel, but there is a bar in the golden tulip up the street. I had an interior room with no view, but very quiet and private. The staff all welcoming and friendly. And underground parking out the heat with direct elevator access to rooms is wonderful. The colors of the hotel and lobby seem dark, subdued, and very Arabic. I really liked this hotel and recommend it. There is a store, laundry, car hotel, restaurants and a bar nearby as well as the metro station. Some rooms have balconies, but those are noisier I believe.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel in front of metro station and very close to mall of emirates”
Reviews.Author: othmane
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, lovely pool area, friendly staff. rooms are spacious and equipped with everything you need. Free parking, would stay again at this hotel and would recommend it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Look for another hotel”
Reviews.Author: joclim
Reviews.Content: Quite old. Cleaners do a hasty job. Tables lamps were not working when I first came in. Coffee/teacups were left uncleaned after daily housekeeping. Location near Mall of Emirates, but with the heat, who'd want to walk to the Mall. They give you 1.5L of bottled water on the first day. Irregardless of the number of days of your stay, you are stuck with that one bottle, over and above that is already chargeable. Breakfast so-so, not a wide range of selection. Quite neighborhood, have to go to the mall for food or use their restaurants, nothing nearby except for a small grocery and laundry shop.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Sachin_Purswani
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located bang opposite Sharaf DG metro station. Mall of Emirates is a 10 min walk from the hotel. Rooms are quite spacious, staff is very courteous. Should you need any supplies, Al Rayan Super market is a 1 min walk from the hotel. Empty Cabbies halt at the hotel gate every 3 mins looking for customers.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, great location”
Reviews.Author: discorocks
Reviews.Content: very pleased all round except the breakfast. checkout was a little complicated as there machine didn't take electron card. room was very spacious and clean and super quiet. wifi good.some rooms have limited views but i don't think dubai has much to look at anyway. walking distance to the mall of the emirates and right next to rail station. buffet breakfast had juice and cereals and toast etc but for me the cooked buffet options were greasy. saying that, for the price i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value”
Reviews.Author: yvr1
Reviews.Content: Check-in was fast and friendly. Room was on the 2nd floor of the 6 story hotel. Room overlooked the interior area of the hotel with no view There was a small window on either side of the room that overlooked the interior courtyard of the hotel, nothing to see whatsoever. Outside rooms seem to have balconies with a view of the surrounding area. I will say that having an interior courtyard room was extremely quiet. Room was quite large, flat screen TV, large double bed, small desk, two chairs and a table, safe, and mini bar. Bahtroom is fairly large, I would caution older or persons with a mobility problem about staying here, as the bath tub/shower is very difficult to get in/out of. There is a large ledge that surrounds the outer part of the tub/shower and it is at least 2 feet wide by 3 feet high and one must negotiage getting across this when entering or leaving the bath area this was not designed very properly. It is difficult and in my opinion could be dangerous to older guests. The rug in the room was in fair condition but it was pulling apart where it was joined leaving an open space between the two carpet pieces. Breakfast was very good and was included in the room rate. The hotel is located just steps from a metro station Sharaf DG and is one stop from Mall of the Emiriates. I would also suggest shopping around for prices for this hotel. I booked with agoda.com and their prices were much less than booking on the hotel website. .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: paulofarabia
Reviews.Content: Cassells is located right next to Sharaf DG metro station so much of Dubai is within easy reach (including the airport). It is also a ten minute walk (or one metro stop) from the Mall of the Emirates and its ski slope. Rooms are well-appointed, spacious and comfortable. The majority of guests are Gulf families so it is not surprising that there is no bar. However, the Locker Room at the Golden Tulip is a two minute walk away if you need to imbibe and watch sport. At the time we stayed, only the lobby restaurant was operating Our few dining experiences were not overwhelming, but there are several small restaurants nearby, as well as the dozens of outlets at the Mall. And if you want something a bit more splendid, the Kempinski and the Pullman are also at the Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fei77
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel under group tour arrangement and I was lucky to get a room in the sixth floor which is an executive floor in the hotel. My room is big, modern and very clean. The breakfast is acceptable. There is al-rayan supermaket in front of the hotel. Near to metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Clean, Wlecoming & Perfectly Located”
Reviews.Author: Xma
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel the first week of December (2010). I was pleasantly surprised by the service & staff, very friendly & responsive. The Hotel is new built and very clean as well with a large Lobby. The Standard Double Room is quite spacious and fully equipped. (With a real bathtub, bidet, hairdryer one in the bathroom & one in the room, flat screen TV, desk, king bed, A/C, 2 armchairs + coffee table...). There are also a Mini Bar, a 24H Room Service, Free tea/coffee replenished daily & a free wireless internet acces (not a real Highspeed connexion but it was enough for working). The hotel is very quiet and has a big Gym for men (with brand news equipment) & a small one reserved for women. There are a small Sauna & Steam Room in the locker room. Then, a Rooftop Pool (unheated) & a small Jacuzzi with a beautiful sunshine all day. It was not my first visit to Dubai, and I still had a great stay at this hotel thanks to its convenient location. Indeed, it is located just in front of the Sharaf DG Metro Station (50m only), a 10-minute walk from the Mall of Emirates, in a quiet area where many small shops (Laudry, mini markets, restaurants, massage center, hairdresser Florist ...). Finally, the Hotel rate is reasonable (including breakfast buffet) regarding to the quality of services. So, I would recommend it for both families & Businessmen, I will certainly return here without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Service”
Reviews.Author: claret286
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my brother and sister. I arranged the booking over email with the manager to get a better rate as I am a UAE resident. First we were given a faulty key. Then they gave us a room that had not been cleaned. I asked for an iron 5 times and got one in the morning!!! We needed an extra bed to which they threw in a fold-up bed and propped it against the wall! As we came back late in the evening I then had to wait a further 30mins for someone to set up the bed and an additional 10minutes for a duvet! May I add the bed was very hard! Breakfast was awful, it is served until 10.30 and we came down at 10. All the food had gone, no bowls or cultery for the cereal, no clean tables for us to sit at. The manager said more food was coming but nothing appeared! There are better places to stay in Dubai for better value for money. This is ashame as the location is great with it being right next to the metro and the Mall of Emirates.

Reviews.Title: “Place to be avoided at all times”
Reviews.Author: Destroyar
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel 3 weeks in advance. When we went to the hotel reception, nobody bothered to attend to us (it seemed that we were invisible). It took them a good 15 minutes to even notice us (after i asked if they will serve me!!). Reluctantly i was served, and was told that room was not ready and i had to wait for 15 mins (my check in time was 2 pm ). Nothing happened after 15 mins and i went and asked again, again he said that room is not ready and asked for another 30 mins. i waited foolishly for another hour and yet nothing happened with no updates. Then i saw a lot of commotion over the check in counter. A lot of people were having heated exchange with the staff. It seems that they had overbooked. Eventually i had joined the fray to "shout, yell and bang tables" to get my room. If i hadn't i think i would have got nothing. Check in time 330 pm. More shocking news - i was given 2 separate single beds even though it was a family booking. What a turn off. when i checked out i asked for a late check out and they refused. It took a few yells from me to the manager to get a late check out (very calculative allowed another 1.5 hrs to make up for the check in delay). Check out process was equally horrendous took 15 mins! Hotel even though is new, the bathroom floor gets flooded with water after showers. The swimming pool is not a heated pool so you get frozen in winters! the only thing good about the hotel is that is the location. very convenient, near mall of emirates and metro is just behind. besides cassells there are many 3 star new hotels. give it a try instead. I will never ever go here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, clean hotel with easy access to Metro”
Reviews.Author: OmarQureshi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short business trip. I have stayed in many hotels / serviced apartments in the Al Barsha area and was pleasantly surprised. It’s a new hotel with spacious, clean rooms and bathrooms. My room rate included breakfast and free wireless Internet access. Staff at reception are responsive and courteous. There was an issue with the safe in my room and the reception sent up a technician to fix it in a couple of minutes. The hotel is right opposite the new Al-Barsha (Sharaf DG) metro station - a one minute walk. There are a couple of supermarkets and take-out restaurants in the surrounding area. Walk to Mall of Emirates takes about 10 minutes but on a hot day one would be better off taking the Metro there. I would recommend it both for families and business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “a nice choice if u are on transit”
Reviews.Author: geodive
Reviews.Content: This hotel is newly built, with nice rooms and excellent service. It is 10 minutes walking away from the Emirates Mall and very very close to a metro station. If u r on transit in Dubai it is rather a good choice....

HotelInfo.Name: Cassells Al Barsha Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: PO Box 114400, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
